documentType: prisoner custody alert notice and internal email
summary: This document consists of an internal email and a Prisoner Custody Alert Notice for Jeffrey Epstein. The email, dated August 1, 2019, provides a synopsis of Epstein's recent activity, noting he was taken off suicide watch on July 30, 2019, and a Suicide Risk Assessment conducted on August 1 found him psychologically stable, despite a note indicating suicidal tendencies after a court appearance. The attached notice formally documents his custody status and alerts, including his offense and mental concerns.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The prisoner at FCI Estill, subject of the custody alert and internal email synopsis detailing his schedule, removal from suicide watch, and a Suicide Risk Assessment.

persons.name: Dr. [Redacted]
persons.context: Conducted the Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) on Epstein on August 1, 2019, with findings indicating he was psychologically stable. The SRA was initiated due to a note Epstein had.

persons.name: Associate Warden (O)
persons.context: Sender of the internal email from FCI Estill providing the synopsis of Epstein's activity.

connections.description: Dr. [Redacted] conducted a Suicide Risk Assessment on Epstein on August 1, 2019, and found him psychologically stable.
The Associate Warden is responsible for the facility housing Epstein and provided an update on his status and schedule.

events.title: Epstein removed from suicide watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was taken off psychological observation/suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein's court appearance
events.description: Epstein had recreation from 6:30-7:30 AM and was in court from 9:30-11:30 AM.

events.title: Attorney conference and Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: Epstein had an attorney conference beginning at 9:00 AM. A Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) was conducted by Dr. [Redacted], finding him psychologically stable. The SRA was initiated because Epstein returned from court with a note indicating suicidal tendencies.

locations: FCI Estill, 100 Prison Road, Estill, SC 29918
keyFacts: On August 1, 2019, a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) was conducted on Jeffrey Epstein, with findings indicating he was 'psychologically stable.'
The SRA was initiated because Epstein had returned from a court appearance on July 31, 2019, with a note indicating suicidal tendencies.
Epstein had been taken off psychological observation/suicide watch on Tuesday, July 30, 2019.
The Prisoner Custody Alert Notice formally documents Epstein's offense as '18 USC 371 SEX TRAFFICKING CONSPIRACY' and lists alerts for 'Sex Offense' and 'Mental Concerns/Suicidal Tendencies.'
The document highlights the timeline and institutional awareness of Epstein's mental state and custody status in the days leading up to his death.
